Class Settlement

  • java.lang.Object
    • Settlement

  • public class Settlement
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a road that is linked to two settlements: source and destination.
    Version:
    1.0 (20th February 2016), 2.0 (15th February 2016)
    Author:
    Chris Loftus, Pip Turner

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        The name of the settlement. Note that there is no way to change the name once created.
        Returns:
        The name of the settlement.

        The current population
        Returns:

      • setPopulation

        public void setPopulation(int size)
        Change the population size
        Parameters:
        size - The new population size

      • getKind

        public SettlementType getKind()
        The kind of settlement, e.g. village, town etc
        Returns:
        The kind of settlement

      • setKind

        public void setKind(SettlementType kind)
        The population has grown or the settlement has been granted a new status (e.g. city status)
        Parameters:
        kind - The new settlement kind

      • add

        public void add(Road road)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a new road to the settlement.
        Parameters:
        road - The new road to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the settlement already contains the road

      • findRoads

        public java.util.ArrayList<Road> findRoads(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a ArrayList of Roads that match the given name
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the road to find
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Road objects (will be a maximum of two items for any settlements: e.g. A487 goes from Aber to Penparcau and from Aber to Bow Street

      • deleteRoads

        public void deleteRoads()
        Deletes all the roads attached to this settlement. It will also detach these roads from the settlements at the other end of each road

      • delete

        public void delete(Road road)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deletes the given road attached to this settlement. It will also detach this road from the settlements at the other end of the road
        Parameters:
        road - The road to delete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if the Road is not connected to this settlement

      • getAllRoads

        public java.util.ArrayList<Road> getAllRoads()
        Returns a list of all the roads connected to this settlement
        Returns:
        The roads attached to this settlement

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks to see if a settlement is equal to another
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The state of the settlement including information about connected roads
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The data in the settlement object.
